page.title: 10WORSHIP AT CROPWELL BUTLER
page.content: The Parish Church for the villages of Cropwell Butler, Tithby, and Wiverton Hall is{Holy Trinity Church}at Tithby; an Early English building famous for its Georgian furnishings. Cropwell Butler has never has a Parish Church although until recently there was a Victorian Chapel-of-Ease. The {Methodist Chapel}has now become the Church of Cropwell Butler, shared by both Anglicans and Methodists, and the evening services are alternately Even- song and Methodist Evening worship; with substantially the same congregation. Morning services are at Tithby, always Anglican, but a few Methodists attend Morning Prayer, so although the arrangement is still informal, there is a high degree of unity in the Church of this parish.
